name.text: Calculating the Volume of a Cylinder

questiontext.text:
The figure below shows a cylinder.

[[jsxgraph]] const brd = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingbox: [-15, 30, 40, -10], axis: false, showNavigation: false, showCopyright: false }); const rx = 5; const ry = 10.5; const L = 30; const y0 = 6; // vertical shift upward ðŸ”‘ // Left ellipse brd.create('curve', [ t => rx * Math.cos(t), t => y0 + ry * Math.sin(t), 0, 2 * Math.PI ], {strokeColor: 'black', fillcolor:'#90caf9', fillOpacity:0.6}); // Right ellipse brd.create('curve', [ t => L + rx * Math.cos(t), t => y0 + ry * Math.sin(t), 0, 2 * Math.PI ], {strokeColor: 'black', dash: 2, fillcolor:'#90caf9', fillOpacity:0.6}); // Top edge of cylinder brd.create('segment', [[0, y0 + ry], [L, y0 + ry]], {strokeColor: 'black'}); // Bottom edge of cylinder brd.create('segment', [[0, y0 - ry], [L, y0 - ry]], {strokeColor: 'black'}); // Dashed diameter on left ellipse brd.create('segment', [[0, y0 - ry], [0, y0 + ry]], {strokeColor: 'black', dash: 2}); // Diameter label brd.create('text', [-4.5, 6, '{#diameter#} cm']); brd.create('text', [10, 18, '{#height#} cm']); [[/jsxgraph]]

  1. Determine the Radius ow the cylinder.

    \(\text{Radius}=\)[[input:ans1]]\(\,\text{cm}\)[[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

  2. Calculate the volume of the cylinder, \(\text{correct to 2 decimal places}\). Use \(\pi=\frac{22}{7}\).

    \(\text{Volume}=\)[[input:ans2]]\(\,\text{cm}^2\)[[validation:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]]

generalfeedback.text:
1. Determining the radius of the cylinder

    From the diagram, the diameter of the cylinder is {@diameter@} cm.
    \( \begin{align} \text{Radius} &= \frac{\text{Diameter}}{2} \\ &= \frac{{@diameter@}}{2} \\ &= {@r@}\ \text{cm} \end{align} \)

  2. Calculating the volume of the cylinder

    The formula for the volume of a cylinder is:
    \( V = \pi r^2 h \)

    Using \(\pi = \frac{22}{7}\), radius \(r = {@r@}\) cm, and height \(h = {@height@}\) cm:
    \( \begin{align} V &= \frac{22}{7} \times ({@r@})^2 \times {@height@} \\ &= {@volume@}\ \text{cm}^3 \\ &= {@Volume_cylinder@}\ \text{cm}^3 \, (\text{to 2 d.p.}) \end{align} \)

questionnote.text:
\(\text{The diameter of a cylinder}={@diameter@}\,\text{cm}\)

\(\text{The height of a cylinder}={@height@}\,\text{cm}\)

\(\text{The Radius of a cylinder}={@r@}\,\text{cm}\)

\(\text{The Volume of a cylinder}={@Volume_cylinder@}\,\text{cm}\)
